item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 9, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. VLC tops 6B downloads, previews AI-generated subtitles (84 points | 53 comments)
2. Nvidia releases its own brand of world models (21 points | 9 comments)
3. NeuralSVG: An Implicit Representation for Text-to-Vector Generation (592 points | 56 comments)
4. Writing a simple pool allocator in C (150 points | 58 comments)
5. Cracking a 512-bit DKIM key for less than $8 in the cloud (697 points | 329 comments)
6. New 16GB Raspberry Pi 5 on sale now at $120 (120 points | 87 comments)
7. Roboflow (YC S20) is hiring an engineer to work on its open source projects ( | hide)
8. Show HN: Atlas of Space (557 points | 108 comments)
9. Show HN: Stagehand – an open source browser automation framework powered by AI (190 points | 36 comments)
10. Man trapped inside driverless car as it spins in circles (20 points | 7 comments)
11. Operating System in 1,000 Lines – Intro (904 points | 97 comments)
12. Industrial photographer Christopher Payne spotlights the good in American labor (65 points | 13 comments)
13. Fidget (445 points | 45 comments)
14. The Latest Fake Literary Agencies (45 points | 8 comments)
15. I had to take down my course-swapping site or be expelled (811 points | 370 comments)

17. Bringing SerenityOS to real hardware, one driver at a time (251 points | 103 comments)
18. Olympians turn to OnlyFans to fund dreams due to 'broken' finance system (2024) (183 points | 311 comments)
19. Who killed the rave? (308 points | 728 comments)
20. Four causes for 'Zoom fatigue' (2021) (20 points | 26 comments)
21. Poka-Yoke (18 points | 7 comments)
22. White House unveils Cyber Trust Mark program for consumer devices (89 points | 66 comments)
23. My Experience Biohacking (29 points | 11 comments)
24. Some programming language ideas (170 points | 140 comments)
25. Robotics 101 at UMich: Applied numerical linear algebra as intro linear algebra (232 points | 55 comments)
26. Drawing Animals with Margaret Mead (6 points | discuss)
27. Steve Langasek, one of Ubuntu Linux's leading lights, has died (216 points | 12 comments)
28. Show HN: LA Wildfire Satellite Analysis (76 points | 29 comments)
29. LA wildfires force thousands to evacuate, NASA JPL closed (320 points | 453 comments)
30. Learning Synths (330 points | 108 comments)
